title-part.text: BUTTONS, PINS, BUCKLES, SLIDE FASTENERS, OR THE LIKE

reference.text: fastenings specially adapted for footwear A43C

note.note-paragraph: This subclass covers buckles or slide fasteners whether used as haberdashery or otherwise.
The following IPC group is not used in the CPC scheme. Subject matter covered by this group is classified in the following CPC group: - A44B1/16 covered by A44B1/14

reference.text: setting on garments A41H37/10 ; setting on footwear A43D100/08 ; making buttons: see the relevant groups in the classes for making articles from particular materials
removable fabric coverings A44B1/123 ; sleeve-links concealing a sewed-on button A44B5/007

title-part.text: adapted for special ways of fastening

CPC-specific-text.text: with quick, thread-like, anchoring means avoiding the use of a separate needle and thread

title-part.text: attached by thread visible to the front
attached by thread not visible to the front
Shank inserted into counterpiece and locked by sliding or rotating
with counterpiece in the form of cotter, split-pin, or the like
with helical wire-shank screwed into material
with head tiltable as a whole
with head formed as two tiltable flaps

CPC-specific-text.text: with head tiltable as a whole

title-part.text: Retainers or tethers for neckties, cravats, neckerchiefs, or the like, e.g. tie-clips, spring clips with attached tie-tethers, woggles, pins with associated sheathing members tetherable to clothing

reference.text: tie-pins A44B9/08 ; decorative or ornamental aspects A44C

title-part.text: Cards for buttons, collar-studs, or sleeve-links
Hat, scarf, or safety pins or the like

reference.text: decorative or ornamental aspect A44C ; hair pins A45D8/02 ; sewing needles D05B85/00
other fastening means for head coverings A42B7/00
pins with associated sheathing members tetherable to clothing A44B6/00

title-part.text: Attaching heads of glass or the like to pin shafts
Similar fasteners for interconnecting straps or the like, e.g. for safety belts

CPC-specific-text.text: covered with cloth or other material; Making thereof
Buckles combined with other articles, e.g. with receptacles

reference.text: A44B11/125 takes precedence; tighteners for securing of load on vehicles B60P7/0823 ; buckles attached to the end of a strap for bundling articles B65D63/16

title-part.text: Strap held by threading through linked rings
engaging holes or the like in strap
with two or more separable parts

reference.text: safety belts in vehicles B60R22/00 ; safety belts for aircraft B64D25/02

CPC-specific-text.text: acting perpendicularly to the main plane of the buckle, e.g. placed on the front face of the buckle
acting parallel to the main plane of the buckle and perpendicularly to the direction of the fastening action
with two buttons acting in opposite directions
acting parallel to the main plane of the buckle and in the same direction as the fastening action
acting in the same plane or in a plane parallel to the main plane of the buckle
with the sliding motion of the buckle providing the opening or closing action
with a pivoting bar retaining a loop of the strap itself
actuated by a rotatable element, e.g. combined with other actuating means
Fastening of other buckle elements to the main buckle

reference.text: buckles with several tongues released by the same mechanism A44B11/2507 to A44B11/2542
buckles for releasing in a vehicle emergency B60R22/32 ; control, alarm, or interlock systems for the correct application of safety belt buckles in vehicles B60R22/48

CPC-specific-text.text: Locking means preventing an unauthorised opening, e.g. by children
fastening by superposing one part on top of the other
followed by sliding in the main plane of the buckle
combined with one buckle element rotating or pivoting
fastening by sliding in the main plane or a plane parallel to the main plane of the buckle
the movement being transverse to the longitudinal direction of the strap or chain

reference.text: A44B11/2507 takes precedence; press-button fasteners A44B17/00

CPC-specific-text.text: with a push-button acting perpendicularly to the main plane of the buckle
with at least one push-button acting parallel to the main plane of the buckle and perpendicularly to the direction of the fastening action

title-part.text: with hooks engaging end-pieces on the strap

CPC-specific-text.text: characterised by their way of fastening to the support
and a backing element on which prongs are bent over
Strips of hook or eye fasteners
characterised by their way of fastening to the support
Press-button fasteners in which the elastic retaining action is obtained by a spring working in the plane of the fastener
Press-button fasteners in which the elastic retaining action is obtained by the own elasticity of the material constituting the fastener
Press-button fasteners consisting of two parts
Press-button fasteners consisting of three parts
Press-button fasteners consisting of four parts
in which each part has similar elements
Devices for cutting loops into hooks
in which each part has similar elements

reference.text: compression moulding or articles of indefinite length characterised by the shape of the surface B29C43/222 ; screen moulding B29C67/08

CPC-specific-text.text: in which each part has similar elements
Adaptations for being fixed to a moulded article during moulding
Hooks or loops provided with means to reinforce the attachment, e.g. by adhesive means

reference.text: tab fastener elements for absorbent pads combining adhesive and mechanical fastening A61F13/581

title-part.text: with a series of separate interlocking members secured to each stringer tape

CPC-specific-text.text: Stringers arranged edge to edge when fastened, e.g. abutting stringers

title-part.text: with substantially rectangular members having interlocking projections and pieces
Stringers arranged side-by-side when fastened, e.g. at least partially superposed stringers
with a one-piece interlocking member on each stringer tape
Interlocking member in the shape of a continuous helix
Interlocking member formed by a profiled or castellated edge
interlocking member having uniform section throughout the length of the stringer
with a third member or members, other than the slider, connected to the edges of adjacent stringers when closed, e.g. third member moved into position by a slider
the third member being embraced by the stringers
the third member embracing the stringers

CPC-specific-text.text: Pull members; Ornamental attachments for sliders
with means for preventing the accidental intrusion of material into the slider body, e.g. with shield or guard
for slide fasteners with edges of stringers having uniform section throughout the length thereof

title-part.text: constructed to be removable from at least one stringer;

CPC-specific-text.text: Sliders with movable parts to permit releasing of the slider in the event of jamming or obstruction
Tools for opening or closing slide fasteners

title-part.text: with means for locking in position

CPC-specific-text.text: at the end of their upward travel with any suitable device, e.g. pull member combined with a press-button, a hook, a key-operated lock
Self-locking sliders, e.g slider body provided with locking projection or groove, friction means
in the form of a locking prong protuding from the pull member
in the form of a locking spring member actuated by the pull member
in the form of a spring-actuated locking member actuated by the pull member

title-part.text: Means for making slide fasteners gas or watertight
Flaps secured to stringers for covering the interlocking members

CPC-specific-text.text: setting slide or glide fastener elements on garments A41H37/06

title-part.text: Means for permanently uniting the stringers at the end
Means for stopping movement of slider at the end
Means at the end of stringer by which the slider can be freed from one stringer, e.g. stringers can be completely separated from each other

CPC-specific-text.text: Separable slide fasteners with quick opening devices
Top end stop means for quick opening slide fasteners
Bottom end stop means for quick opening slide fasteners

title-part.text: Connection of separate, or one-piece, interlocking members to stringer tapes
Reinforcing such connections, e.g. by stitching
Making by processes not fully provided for in one other class, e.g. B21D53/50 , B21F45/18 , B22D17/16 , B29D5/00

reference.text: attaching closure devices, e.g. slide fasteners, to bags B31B19/00 ; making package opening by applying or incorporating profile strips, e.g. for reclosable bags B65B61/188

title-part.text: Securing metal interlocking members to ready-made stringer tapes

reference.text: making metal slide fastener parts combined with attaching B21D53/52
article handling devices associated with conveyers in general B65G47/00 , e.g. B65G47/14

title-part.text: Securing the interlocking members to stringer tapes while making the latter
Removing interlocking members to produce gaps
Applying end stops upon stringer tapes
Assembling sliders in position on stringer tapes
Slider holders for assemblage of slide fasteners
Subject matter not provided for in other groups of this subclass
